The resulting object is a rectangular prism with three cylindrical holes along the Z-axis at the following coordinates: - Hole 1: `(0.0188, 0.0188, -0.3125/2)` - Hole 2: `(0.0188, 0.6437, -0.3125/2)` - Hole 3: `(0.3938, 0.0188, -0.3125/2)` *Cut Operation* 1. Subtract the three cylindrical holes from the rectangular prism. The final object is a rectangular metal plate with three cylindrical holes at the following coordinates: - Hole 1: `(0.0188, 0.0188, -0.3125/2)` - Hole 2: `(0.0188, 0.6437, -0.3125/2)` - Hole 3: `(0.3938, 0.0188, -0.3125/2)` with the following dimensions: - Length: 0.6625 - Width: 0.6625 - Height: 0.3125</description>
